alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 9:02PM EDT until further notice by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme) affecting Iron County. .Water levels remain high along the Michigamme River near Crystal Falls. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Elevated river levels caused by excessive rainfall continue. * WHERE...Michigamme River near Crystal Falls (Michigamme). * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, 3700 cfs - River begins to flood additional low lying areas along the river bank * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 7.8 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Report observed flooding to the National Weather Service in Marquette and local emergency services when you can do so safely. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday morning at 1100 AM CDT.
